thread.title: The Apprentice has begun and it's made everyone on Twitter very, very angry
thread.title_full: The Apprentice has begun and it's made everyone on Twitter very, very angry

title: The Apprentice has begun and it's made everyone on Twitter very, very angry
text:
The Apprentice has begun and it's made everyone on Twitter very, very angry The Apprentice has begun and it's made everyone on Twitter very, very angry 
‚ÄúI want the cars, I want the girls, but most of all I want the power.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI am disgustingly ambitious.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm the Swiss army knife of business skills.‚Äù 
So the new series of The Apprentice began. (Jim Marks/Boundless/BBC) 
The teams were tasked with haggling for fish at Billingsgate Market and turning it into delicious lunches for hungry Londoners. 
Unfortunately, tepid calamari, huge fish cakes and pricey salads were tougher to shift than our 18 candidates expected. (Boundless/BBC) 
And the axe fell for Dan Callaghan, who didn‚Äôt even mange one measly sale‚Ä¶ 
(To be fair, here‚Äôs what they were trying to hawk) ¬£9 for a salad! pic.twitter.com/FI7b4w5QDe 
‚Äî Lady Karren Brady (@karren_brady) October 14, 2015 
Naturally everyone on up in arms as the candidates made mistake after mistake after mis-hake. 
Here‚Äôs how the episode went down. 
The opening lines already began to grate. "I what the cars, I want the girls". Does he think he's applied to be the next Bond? #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Andy Goulding (@AndyGoulding) October 14, 2015 2 minutes in and I want all of the candidates fired immediately. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî GRM MCKRRCHR (@biggerhalf) October 14, 2015 
Then everyone saw Ruth‚Äôs hideous suit. Is this #TheApprentice Clown edition? Seriously‚Ä¶ What is that suit?! 
‚Äî Joe Michniewicz (@JMichniewicz1) October 14, 2015 Suited and booted?!?! Look like a fruit salad. Horrendous suit #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Michael Grande (@mycallgrande) October 14, 2015 Why is she wearing a suit made from 80's british rail train seat material? #TheApprentice 
Claude made his first menacing entrance. Only one man gets this reaction when he walks into a room. Welcome, @claudelittner . #theapprentice pic.twitter.com/UOrjFeIPn9 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 Claude knows where the bodies are buried‚Ä¶.. because he put them there!!!! #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Chloe Humphrey (@ChloeGenevieve1) October 14, 2015 
Everyone went wild when Lord Sugar mentioned Tinder (and quickly deleted their account). Lord Sugar: Darling, I made a Tinder joke on #TheApprentice .Wife: How do you know what Tinder is?Lord Sugar: ‚Ä¶.Wife: Get inside. 
‚Äî Lily Lipstick (@LilyLippy) October 14, 2015 Imagine going on Tinder and seeing Sugar on there though. #TheApprentice pic.twitter.com/CtytDe8rDH 
‚Äî Captain Kidd (@kidd_kong78) October 14, 2015 
For the first time in Apprentice history, the teams were mixed. Oh really changing it up there BBC‚Ä¶ Mixed teams how novel! Running out of ideas there? #bbcapprentice #theapprentice 
‚Äî Matt Jenkinson (@MattJenki) October 14, 2015 "First time we've had mixed teams in the first task" SHADES ON EVERYONE IT'S A BRIGHT NEW DAWN #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Mike de los Muertos (@cincodemayoMike) October 14, 2015 How innovative and thrilling. Mixed teams. . #theApprentice 
‚Äî Jill Mansell (@JillMansell) October 14, 2015 
‚ÄúSugababes‚Äù 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 Most of them have probably been a member of the Sugababes at some point. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî The Wittiest One (@thewittiestone) October 14, 2015 I still think they should've listened to Dan and gone with #Sugababes as their team name.. #TheApprentice . pic.twitter.com/Q7J8mkt5O5 
‚Äî Jamie Hough (@jmehough) October 14, 2015 
Surely the best reason to be a PM? 'I cook and I'm intolerant to loads of food's'‚Ä¶I want the blonde one to win #reasonstoprojectmanageafoodtask #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Jayne Gross (@Fairyjayne) October 14, 2015 "i have eaten food before" YAAS BE PROJECT MANAGER YOU SOUND SO QUALIFIED FOR THIS JOB #theapprentice 
‚Äî alice pearson (@iamjeanralphio) October 14, 2015 #theapprentice Not only do I cook, I also EAT food. Prime project manger material aren't I? 
Fishy goings-on at Billingsgate Market. And the award for worst job title on #theapprentice ever goes to‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúFishfinger Team Leader‚Äù. pic.twitter.com/lUC8mwhxZo 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 Calamari and fish finger sandwich?Masterchef has finished, Love. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî BOILED ONIONS!!!! (@NormanCGull) October 14, 2015 Most lunchtimes I'm thinking 'why is no-one in a bad suit trying to sell me calamari and fish fingers?' #theapprentice 
‚Äî Gordon Hunt (@glhunt31) October 14, 2015 Captain Birdseye's name being dragged through the muck there, with a fish finger and calamari sandwich #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Rob Smedley (@robsmedley86) October 14, 2015 
‚ÄúIs this an onion?‚Äù‚Äì Mergim Butaja, 2015. Did he honestly just say "IS THIS AN ONION?!" Oh. Help #TheApprentice @bbcapprentice 
‚Äî Simon Beale (@SimonBeale) October 14, 2015 Is that an onion? Who finds these people?? #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Football‚Ä¶.eh??!! (@notnek73) October 14, 2015 
Look, Selina‚Äôs not a squid purveyor, ok? 'I'm not a squid purveyor.' I need a framed needlepoint of this for my kitchen. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Bee Jones (@BitOfFun) October 14, 2015 "I'm not the squid purveyor, I'm the squid purveyor's son‚Ä¶" etc. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Jonathan M Smith (@tweetmonkeyj) October 14, 2015 
NINE POUNDS FOR A TUNA SALAD!!! ¬£9 for tuna Ni√ßoise. You've gotta hand it to them for coming up with something more ludicrously priced than a London bedsit. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Miss L (@ProResting) October 14, 2015 ¬£9 for a salad?! A ¬£3 Tesco meal deal would be a better option #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Dan Clifford (@DanCliffordCTFC) October 14, 2015 ¬£9.00. 9 English Pounds. 9 whole English Pounds. FOR A SALAD #TheApprentice 
‚Äî dave evans (@evansbigdave) October 14, 2015 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm a wordsmith‚Äù, says children‚Äôs tutor Sam. 'I'm a wordsmith.' There have already been SO MANY MOMENTS where I want to eat my own fist #TheApprentice 
‚Äî James Longman (@JamesAALongman) October 14, 2015 I'm a wordsmith. No. Really. I am. Make sure you say 'lemony'. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Amanda Jennings (@MandaJJennings) October 14, 2015 "I'm a tutor, I'm a wordsmith" mate you probably read cat in the hat to year 3 #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Reece Christie (@ReeceChristie) October 14, 2015 
When Brett slavishly stuck to the specifications ‚Äì and only made 89 fishcakes. You honestly can't have ever believed you were going to make 300 fish cakes #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Andrew Havis (@AndrewHavis) October 14, 2015 
You know who really loves fish? Vegans‚Ä¶ They walked into a vegan/vegetarian restaurant trying to sell fish products #TheApprentice pic.twitter.com/SviMic9xoy 
‚Äî Ronke Lawal (@ronkelawal) October 14, 2015 Selling fishfingers to a vegan restaurant is the new selling ice to eskimos. #theapprentice 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 Coals to Newcastle, fish to the vegan bar, lambs to the slaughter x #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Sally Ann Matthews (@SallyAnMatthews) October 14, 2015 
Versatile played Russian Roulette with London‚Äôs stomachs. "We may have a calamari problem"Or"We literally have a box of death right now" #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Darryl Edge (@DarrylEdge) October 14, 2015 'All that's left is raw calamari'. Or, if you're sound of sight, campylobacter in an icebox. Nice. #TheApprentice #guppy üò≥ 
‚Äî Hannah Cook (@BeautyLaureate) October 14, 2015 Raw calamari must be kept below a certain temperature, SO YOU LEAVE IT SAT IN THE SUN #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Paige Salt (@saltypaige) October 14, 2015 I love the last hour of a task ‚Äì the smell of desperation is stronger than the smell of the warm calamari‚Ä¶ #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Fliss B (@eris348) October 14, 2015 
Enter the boardroom (*hums Prokofiev*). 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 They should've replaced Lord Sugar with Captain Birdseye for the boardroom. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Ben Rawson-Jones (@rawsonjones) October 14, 2015 
Connexus made just ¬£1.87 profit. ¬£1.87?!?!!! That's under 21p per day for each teammate. #livingwage #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Matt Edmondson (@MattEdmondson) October 14, 2015 ¬£1.87 profit?!! Has to be one of the worst ever on the show! April, you're fired! üëà #TheApprentice 
‚Äî PhilRIP Ellis (@Philip_Ellis) October 14, 2015 A profit of ¬£1.87!!!!Don't even wait to be fired.Just resign. #TheApprentice pic.twitter.com/zJU6b3rjz8 
‚Äî Ronke Lawal (@ronkelawal) October 14, 2015 Embarrassing to only get ¬£1.87 profit. Although, they could get 37 plastic bags with that #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Dan Bartlett (@dan_bartlett) October 14, 2015 
But, but, Brett stuck to the specifications! This guy talking about specifications 100% reads the terms and conditions #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Sean McBay (@Sean_McBay) October 14, 2015 If I had 10p for everytine Conexus said 'specifications', I'd have a larger profit than them #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Michael Hogan (@michaelhogan) October 14, 2015 
April brought back in Brett and Dan and Karen revealed Brett was actually a chef. This is first time in the history of #theapprentice that someone has been brought into the boardroom due to an oversized fishcake. 
‚Äî The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 14, 2015 "So you're a chef?""No, I think you'll find I'm a fully qualified catering assistant" #TheApprentice 
‚Äî B E G L E Y (@JosephBegley) October 14, 2015 "You were working as a sous chef in a fish resturant on Plymouth Hoe, when I met yo " #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Chris Hitchings (@cwnhitch) October 14, 2015 
‚ÄúI can‚Äôt sell, I can‚Äôt cook ‚Äì shoot me‚Äù // ‚ÄúI did the pans‚Ä¶‚Äù You sold zilch, so what did you do? "I sliced the olives, the tomatoes, did the pans & things.." -Dan #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Prabhjot Hunjan (@PrabsHunjan) October 14, 2015 "I can't see and I can't cook, so shoot me" God I hope Dan survives. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Paul Waugh (@paulwaugh) October 14, 2015 You can't fire dan for being slow in the kitchen! It's a buisness show not bake off‚Ä¶ Miss Jamaica "You're fired" #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Daniel Lassman (@Danlassman) October 14, 2015 Someone's got to do the pans. That's my new catchphrase #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Ben Hatch Novelist (@BenHatch) October 14, 2015 
And then Dan was tragically/rightly fired. Dan. You're intelligent personable and articulate. You're fired. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Peter Smith (@Redpeter99) October 14, 2015 Anyone who says on the first week of #TheApprentice that they "can't sell to the public" has already lost. Dan had to go 
‚Äî George Thorpe (@gthorpeofficial) October 14, 2015 C'mon Dan! You can't go on #TheApprentice & say you can't sell. That's like going into a vegan shop with a pile of fish. Oh wait‚Ä¶ 
‚Äî Nathan Caton (@NathanCaton) October 14, 2015 If Dan had been able to get his coat from the van he might have sold something rather than having to run around to keep warm #TheApprentice 
‚Äî Paul Wiltshire (@Paulwiltshire) October 14, 2015 Dan seemed like a nice guy. Pretty bright. Articulate. Obviously he left first. #TheApprentice 
‚Äî James Longman (@JamesAALongman) October 14, 2015 surely somebody dropped out of the show last minute and dan was just nearby to the set so was used to fill the numbers üëÄ #TheApprentice Share article
